lines.text: Ingredient History Database Monthly Progress Report - June 1996
These are the status and plans for the project as of the end of June 1996. Please contact me if you
After two errors by the label manufacturer, good labels were received the morning that
labeling operations began. Most documents except for Cigarente Specification and non-ABC
Disclosure documents have now been labeled. Documents in the ABC group thst were not :
numbered, were assigned the same number as the preceding document with a letter suffix.
The PM USA Job Order was,approved and purchase orders were issued on June 28. Sybase
software for Windows NT has been received.
A memo was written by R. Fenner to R. McMath formally requesting the use of T3Wi for this
project. The request to R. McMath's group included air handling for the additional heat load
of the 14 comuputers and large screen monitors, increascd number power outlets, additional
telephones (3), Westinghouse badge readers for all three doors, infrared detectors for exits,
raising the wall height of the room, and installing a 10" raised floor for network wiring.
Furoiture requirements are being reviewed and will be ordered if required. A sketch of the
proposed layout is attached. It is planned that the network and database servers, and tape/disk
peripherals will be located in the separately secure audio/visual roorn adjacent to T3wi.
The Sybase relational database design has begun. Microsoft Acccss 7.o is being used for the
creation of database entry forms. Forms for supporting as-is entry of flavor formulations, leaf
formulations, and vendor disclosures are ready for testing.

full_text:
ATTORNEY
WORK PRODUCTS
Philip Morris USA PRIORITY
PHILIP MORRIS U.S.A.
7\20$96
INTEROFFICE CORRESPONDENCE
Richmond, Virginia
Copy to DonShinng
To:
David Willian
Date: July 12, 1996 D.L-Dc
From:
Bennie Good
Subject:
Ingredient History Database Monthly Progress Report - June 1996
These are the status and plans for the project as of the end of June 1996. Please contact me if you
have any questions at extension 2559.
I. Status.'
A. Label Operations
-
After two errors by the label manufacturer, good labels were received the morning that
labeling operations began. Most documents except for Cigarente Specification and non-ABC
Disclosure documents have now been labeled. Documents in the ABC group thst were not :
numbered, were assigned the same number as the preceding document with a letter suffix.
B. System Acquisition .
The PM USA Job Order was,approved and purchase orders were issued on June 28. Sybase
software for Windows NT has been received.
C. Room Preparation
A memo was written by R. Fenner to R. McMath formally requesting the use of T3Wi for this
project. The request to R. McMath's group included air handling for the additional heat load
of the 14 comuputers and large screen monitors, increascd number power outlets, additional
telephones (3), Westinghouse badge readers for all three doors, infrared detectors for exits,
raising the wall height of the room, and installing a 10" raised floor for network wiring.
Furoiture requirements are being reviewed and will be ordered if required. A sketch of the
proposed layout is attached. It is planned that the network and database servers, and tape/disk
peripherals will be located in the separately secure audio/visual roorn adjacent to T3wi.
D. Database Development
The Sybase relational database design has begun. Microsoft Acccss 7.o is being used for the
creation of database entry forms. Forms for supporting as-is entry of flavor formulations, leaf
formulations, and vendor disclosures are ready for testing.
DOCCODE: P0622
